question: Question_A_04
statement:
Shown in the figure below is a function and its tangent line at
$x = x_0$.

(img)

The tangent line intersects the \emph{x} axis at the point $x = x_1$.
The coordinate of the point $x_1$ is

(a) $x_1 = x_0 + \frac{f(x_0)}{f'(x_0)}$

(b) $\displaystyle x_1 = x_0 - f'(x_0)(x-x_0)$

(c) $x_1 = x_0 - \frac{f'(x_1)}{f(x_1)}$

(d) $x_1 = x_0 + \frac{f'(x_1)}{f(x_1)}$

(e) $x_1 = x_0 - \frac{f(x_0)}{f'(x_0)}$
